body_html: Of course if you turn off cudnn backend, you can not get CUDNN_STATUS_BAD_PARAM error. Memory use of pytorch's cudnn rnn module has been a topic of a long standing discussion, still not quite resolved, to the best of my knowledge. You are trying to run very long sequences (6000) through a reasonably large network, you are working somewhere at the memory limit. I agree segfaults should not happen, and if you have a repro, please post it, but your problem is pushing hardware to the limit.
